title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 17:06  
cjdelisle - (17:06): !news  
abusenius - (17:07): he is back :)  
cjdelisle - (17:07): XWIKI-5405  
cjdelisle - (17:08): misleading title but the jira bot works.  
cjdelisle - (17:09): and it is indeed logging.  
SiX-P4cK - (17:10): convert v1 --> v2 doens't exist? http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3080  
cjdelisle - (17:11): it does. it works "ok" for text content. It fails miserably for script.  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 17:11  
SiX-P4cK - (17:11): f\*ck  
SiX-P4cK - (17:12): i can't convert a sortable table  
SiX-P4cK - (17:14): nobody have an exemple?  
cjdelisle - (17:15): sortable table is a static table which is built dynamically  
SiX-P4cK - (17:16): i want a dynamic sortable table  
SiX-P4cK - (17:16): it's work on xwiki 1  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 17:17  
cjdelisle - (17:18): you can still use xwiki 1 syntax in xwiki 2.0

lucaa joined #xwiki at 21:01  
lucaa left at 21:07 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 21:32  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 22:24  
sdumitriu - (22:25): Hey abusenius  
sdumitriu - (22:25): You're a committer, congrats!  
abusenius - (22:26): thanks :)  
abusenius - (22:28): btw, sdumitriu, I have a question, do we still support iso encoding?  
sdumitriu - (22:28): Yes  
sdumitriu - (22:28): Even xwiki.org is using it  
abusenius - (22:28): but the content is not converted  
abusenius - (22:28): so either everything is iso or utf  
sdumitriu - (22:28): (which is wrong, IMO, but nobody dares to switch it to UTF)  
sdumitriu - (22:29): Yes, the encoding must be the same for all the content  
abusenius - (22:29): there was a mail about encoding on the list, it seems that escapetool.xml escapes utf character like ä to entities  
sdumitriu - (22:30): Yes  
abusenius - (22:30): which is good for iso and bad for utf  
sdumitriu - (22:30): I debugged it a few days ago  
sdumitriu - (22:30): It's hardcoded in EscapeTool  
abusenius - (22:31): this is quite bad, many utf-aware apps seem not to bother decoding entities  
abusenius - (22:32): maybe we should use different escaping methods depending on encoding?  
sdumitriu - (22:33): Yes  
sdumitriu - (22:33): But this means extending EscapeTool  
sdumitriu - (22:34): I'd be +1 for this solution, since it causes other problems as well  
abusenius - (22:34): yes, me too  
abusenius - (22:34): xml entities are not standard  
abusenius - (22:35): they just happen to work most of the time :)  
cjdelisle - (22:39): Any idea as to why tests with  By.cssSelector  are all failing on my machine? I have nothing special (Linux/FF/OpenJDK). I keep getting "CSS Selectors not supported natively"  
cjdelisle - (22:42): google is particularly unhelpful.  
sdumitriu - (22:43): Does it really open Firefox?  
cjdelisle - (22:44): yea, the whole test runs, it just blows up on the line that calls the css selector.  
sdumitriu - (22:46): Which version of FF?  
cjdelisle - (22:47): 3.6.8 but it was happening when I used 3.6.3  
cjdelisle - (22:47): err hang on. /usr/bin/firefox is a 3.0.10 let me make sure that isn't being run...  
lucaa left at 22:50 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
sdumitriu - (22:53): If that's not the cause, try using the Sun JDK  
cjdelisle - (22:54): I think that was it. just killing all the processes I've left attached to the ports.  
sdumitriu left at 22:55 (Quit: Leaving.  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 23:30
